full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 734-8 Filed 07/15/22 Page 13 of 13
Probate ST-19-PB-0080 182
1 A. It's expressly spelled out in the protocol, yes.
2 Q. And they can still go to law enforcement. Period. Full stop. It's up to them?
3 A. It's up to them and they can go public. That's up to them. The estate cannot. The administrator cannot.
4 Q. On Page 8, Ms. George says that the program, quote, presents an unavoidable conflicts of interest, close quote, between the executors and the program. She said, the Co-Executors have, quote, an inescapable conflict of interest in recommending a program that proposes to compensate any individual or entity making such allegations requiring in return overly broad releases. Do you have a view on this?
5 A. You have to ask the estate on that. I can tell you that before we agreed to take on this assignment, Ms. Feldman and myself and Ms. Biros, we have received absolute assurances from the estate that they will play no role in the day-to-day administration of this program.
DOJ-OGR-00011518

1 A. It's expressly spelled out in the protocol, yes.
2 Q. And they can still go to law enforcement. Period. Full stop. It's up to them?
3 A. It's up to them and they can go public. That's up to them. The estate cannot. The administrator cannot.
4 Q. On Page 8, Ms. George says that the program, quote, presents an unavoidable conflicts of interest, close quote, between the executors and the program. She said, the Co-Executors have, quote, an inescapable conflict of interest in recommending a program that proposes to compensate any individual or entity making such allegations requiring in return overly broad releases. Do you have a view on this?
5 A. You have to ask the estate on that. I can tell you that before we agreed to take on this assignment, Ms. Feldman and myself and Ms. Biros, we have received absolute assurances from the estate that they will play no role in the day-to-day administration of this program.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript or deposition. The text is typed, and there are no visible stamps or handwritten notes.
